channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Latino audience is key for NFL growth in the U.S. and abroad
item.description: The NFL is itching for further growth and it's turning to Latino and Spanish-speaking audiences as a new audience.

item.title: A tough new EU cyber law is off to a messy start, with many countries failing to adopt the rules
item.description: New European Union rules requiring businesses to bolster their cyber defenses are already off to a messy start.

item.title: People with felony records can now vote in Nebraska—and that could make a big difference in November
item.description: Nebraska’s top election official had no authority to strip voting rights from people convicted of a felony, the state Supreme Court ruled Wednesday.

item.title: Nestle says its sales are suffering due to Israel boycotts
U.S.-listed shares of TSMC rise 8% in premarket after quarterly profit soars on AI demand
item.description: TSMC, the world’s largest producer of advanced chips, posted a 54% hike in third-quarter profit.

item.title: Furloughed Italian Fiat workers are struggling to pay their mortgages amid Stellantis crisis
item.description: Fiat workers have been in limbo for a year as parent Stellantis fights falling sales.

item.title: Taiwan Semi shares jump as contract chipmaker forecasts sales above estimates
Harris and Trump release new policy details in interview blitz as campaign comes to the end
item.description: Here are some takeaways from the cascade of appearances.

item.title: Expedia stock jumps on report of acquisition interest by Uber
Musk’s empire risks being targeted by EU for potential X fines
item.description: The EU may target Elon Musk’s broader business empire for X fines, potentially including revenue from SpaceX and Neuralink to increase penalties.

item.title: Biden administration forgives $4.5 billion in student debt for over 60,000 public service workers
item.description: The Biden administration announced on Thursday that it was forgiving another $4.5 billion in student debt for over 60,000 borrowers.

item.title: Amazon joins the nuclear party
item.description: Google, Microsoft, and now Amazon are in pursuit of power. Literally and figuratively.

item.title: Auto giants launch a flurry of cheaper electric vehicles — taking the fight to China
item.description: Europe's top carmakers unveiled low-cost EVs at the Paris Motor Show this week, seeking to recapture some of the market share held by Chinese brands.

item.title: Disney has added a VIP park perk that runs up to $449. Why that’s now the norm.
Student debt cancelled for 1 million public servants, other relief in limbo
